subject: Re: [junit] Test with no @Test inside, was Re: Test with no class inside
msgSnippet: ... Yes, and so I m surprised you still have the problem. I meant in the sense of that worked for me, so you should ask the Eclipse people, since it s
messageBody:
Al May wrote:

> I wonder what you mean by "Marking the super-test-class abstract" in
> your reply. Is my superclass (FirstTest) not already abstract ?

Yes, and so I'm surprised you still have the problem. I meant in the
sense of "that worked for me, so you should ask the Eclipse people,
since it's probably an Eclipse problem, not a JUnit problem."
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
